pages.text: For your first ritual you will summon a spirit known as the $(thing)Ore Crusher$(), which converts ores to dusts, effectively doubling them. You will prepare sacrificial bowls, ritual chalk, craft a book of binding, draw your first pentacle and finally summon the spirit

First, burn Otherstone in a furnace and burn Otherworld Logs in $(thing)Spiritfire$(), then craft the resulting ashes into impure white chalk, and finally purify it once more in $(thing)Spiritfire$(). The chalk can now be used to draw ritual glyphs to form pentacles. View the chapter on pentacles for possible options.

Candles provide stability to rituals and are an important part of almost all pentacles. To make candles, kill large animals like pigs, cows or sheep with a Butcher Knife to harvest their fat in the form of tallow and use that to craft candles.

Craft Otherstone into the shape of a bowl to create a sacrificial bowl. These bowls are used to sacrifice items as part of a ritual and you will need a handful of them. Then take one of the bowls and craft it into a golden sacrificial bowl by surrounding it with gold ingots.
This special sacrificial bowl is used to activate the ritual by right-clicking it with the activation item, usually a book of binding, once everything has been set up and you are ready to start.

pages.title: The Ritual
pages.text: The ritual is described in $(thing)$(l:rituals/summoning/summon_crusher)the section on rituals$(/l)$() but these pages will walk the gentle reader through the process step by step.$(br2)We start by placing the golden sacrificial bowl and drawing the appropriate pentacle, $(l:pentacles/summon_foliot)Aviar's Circle$(/l). $(br)Next, place four sacrificial bowls close to the pentacle and place copper, iron, silver and gold ore each in one bowl.

Now craft a $(item)Book of Binding: Foliot$() and combine it with this guide book to assign a spirit name. $(br)Finally, right-click the golden sacrificial bowl with the resulting book and wait until the crusher spawns. $(br)Now all that remains is to drop appropriate ores near the crusher and wait for it to turn it into dust.
